alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 3:59PM CDT until June 04 at 5:17AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Custer and Washita Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Approximately 3 thousand acres of rural lands are covered by depths up to 2 feet... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Depths may be greater at locations where small streams enter the Washita River valley below Clinton. Some farmsteads are flooded and others isolated by water over local roads. Some farm levees may be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to rise to a crest of 20.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.
